events.title: DeepSeek R1 Released
events.description: Chinese open-source reasoning model with 671B parameters. Matches OpenAI o1 on benchmarks (79.8% AIME, 97.4% MATH). Built for ~$6M. Caused stock market turbulence.

events.title: Stargate Project Announced
events.description: $500 billion AI infrastructure initiative announced by President Trump with OpenAI, SoftBank, and Oracle.

events.title: Claude 3.7 Sonnet with Extended Thinking
events.description: Introduced user-controllable reasoning depth. Set the trend for 'thinking modes' across the industry.

events.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro Released
events.description: Google's 'most intelligent model' at the time. Strong multimodal capabilities.

events.title: OpenAI Closes $40B Funding Round
events.description: Largest private tech funding round in history. $300B post-money valuation.

events.title: DeepSeek R1-0528 Update
events.description: Major improvements in inference and hallucination reduction.

events.title: Grok 4 Released
events.description: Elon Musk's xAI releases Grok 4 with strong reasoning capabilities.

events.title: Claude Opus 4.1 Released
events.description: Coding capabilities hit 74.5% on SWE-bench Verified. Major leap for programming assistance.

events.title: GPT-5 Released
events.description: Called 'the iPhone of AI models' — polished but some called it 'flat' vs GPT-4o's personality. Reasoning effort settings introduced.

events.title: Grok 4.1 Released
events.description: Start of the '25-Day War' of model releases.

events.title: Gemini 3 + Deep Think Released
events.description: Google's comeback. Includes Gemini Agent and Antigravity environment. ChatGPT share drops from 72.9% to 68%, Gemini rises 13.3% to 18.2%.

events.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Released
events.description: Beloved by programmers. Best model for coding, agents, and computer use. Strong on long-context agentic work.

events.title: GPT-5.2 Released
events.description: Instant/Thinking/Pro variants. 70.9% on benchmarks. End of the '25-Day War'.

events.title: Agentic AI Foundation Formed
events.description: Major companies form foundation backed by Linux Foundation to create open standards for AI agents.

events.title: Meta Acquires Manus AI
events.description: Singapore-based autonomous AI agent company acquired for $2-3 billion.

events.title: Moltbook Launches
events.description: First social network for AI agents. 1.6M+ agents by Feb. Elon calls it 'beginning of singularity.' Sam Altman calls it 'a fad.'

events.title: OpenClaw Goes Viral
events.description: Open-source AI agent framework hits 145K+ GitHub stars. Powers the Moltbook ecosystem.

events.title: Peter Steinberger Joins OpenAI
events.description: OpenClaw creator joins OpenAI. OpenClaw becomes open-source foundation.

themes.name: Year of the Agent
themes.description: AI agents became real products — OpenAI Operator, Claude Computer Use, OpenClaw, Manus AI. Agents buying cars, spawning child agents, creating social networks.

themes.name: Reasoning Models Go Mainstream
themes.description: Started with o1, democratized by DeepSeek R1. 'Extended Thinking' / 'Deep Think' becomes standard toggle across all major models.

themes.name: China's Open-Source Surge
themes.description: DeepSeek R1 proved frontier AI doesn't require billions. Qwen, DeepSeek-V3, Kling video gen all competitive with Western closed models.

themes.name: Vibe Coding Revolution
themes.description: Andrej Karpathy coins 'vibe coding'. Tools like Cursor, Lovable, Replit, Bolt enable non-programmers to ship real apps.

themes.name: Video Generation War
themes.description: Sora 2, Veo 3.1, Kling 3.0 compete. Synchronized audio generation arrives. Deepfake crisis triggers legislation.
